text: QUITO, April 12 Ecuadorean banker Guillermo Lasso, who won the South American countrys presidency in a Sunday runoff, said on Monday he would not raise the value-added tax but still planned to eliminate the cash-strapped countrys fiscal deficit within four years.Lasso told reporters he would also propose a risk-sharing model for future oil deals, though he would respect the service contracts the country currently has with private firms. (Reporting by Alexandra Valencia in Quito Writing by Luc Cohen Editing by Chris Reese)
